31000.name: South of Phatep
31000.description:
The great walls of the City of Phatep stand to the north of here,
rising up on either side of the massive wooden gates and encircling
the entire city. Guards in strange-looking, conical helmets patrol
the top of the walls, watching the lands beyond the city limits for
signs of danger. In all other directions - south, west and east -
lies the vast, seemingly endless expanse of the Great Haranian desert.
The sands glow in the sun and the air seems to ripple in the heat.
There are no trails through the desert, and all directions look much
the same. Far to the east of here, the faint, barely discernible outline
of the Kithan Mountains rise up against the horizon, pale blue against
the background and wreathed in a fine blanket of mist.

exdescs.desc_night:
The great walls of the City of Phatep stand to the north of here,
a black shape against the blacker darkness of the night. Warmly
glowing lights illuminate the tops of the walls, where guards patrol
night and day, watching the surrounding lands for signs of danger.
Two tall towers topped with minarets frame the wide, strong-looking
gates and soft, pale moonlight bathes the town in a pearl-like glow.
To the south, east and west stretches the endless sands of the Great
Desert. The normally golden sands are now a gentle silver, like a sea
of molten metal. To the far east, the Kithan mountains are framed
against the starry sky like powerful black sentinels, watching over
the desert and the city.

31001.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31001.description:
This is the edge of the Great Haranian Desert, a vast area that covers
much of the Haran region. The golden sands vanish into the horizon to
the west and south and to a long way east where they eventually join
the small peaks at the base of the Kithan Mountains, To the north is
the long, broad walls that surround the City of Phatep. Guards patrol
the walls night and day, and the smells of spiced meat cooking on open
braziers drifts over on the desert breeze.

exdescs.desc_night:
This is the edge of the Great Haranian Desert, a vast area that covers
much of the Haran region. The sweeping dunes of sand that expand out
from here to the west, south and east, look strangely surreal in the
pearly glow of the moon, like a smooth, endless carpet of silver. In
the distance to the east, framed against the starry night sky are the
Kithan Mountains. To the north is the southern wall of the City of
Phatep. The thick wooden gates of the city can be reached by travelling
west and north from here.

31002.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31002.description:
The massive, thick walls of the City of Phatep stand to the north of
here, completely surrounding the city to protect it from attack and
from the harsh environment of the desert. The seemingly endless sands
stretch away like a vast sea of golden-brown as far as the eye can
see to the south. To the east, it runs up to the very edge of the
great Kithan Mountain range. A few small date trees stand up close
to the wall, but not high enough that an enemy could use them to
gain access to the interior of Phatep. The gates stand someway west
of here.

exdescs.desc_night:
Torches burn brightly from sconces at the top of the massive walls
of Phatep that run east and west from here around the city. The
flickering yellow lights do little to banish the darkness of the
night, but the do help to highlight the numerous guards that patrol
the top of the wall throughout the night. The Great desert extends
south, away from the wall. Moonlight illuminates only a small part,
but even without the benefit of sight, it is obvious that the
desert is huge. Some way east of here, the black outline of the
Kithan Mountains can be seen, silhouetted against the starlit sky.

31003.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31003.description:
Several young date trees grow close to the wall here, but not close
enough that they provide any kind of advantage in climbing the huge
Phatepian walls that run to the east and west from here. They are
tall and thick and look near impenetrable. Attentive guards patrol
the top of the walls night and day, keeping watch on the desert sands
that stretch away south, east and west from here. Looming large in the
distance to the east are the Kithan Mountains.

exdescs.desc_night:
Soft, pale moonlight slants down from the night sky, surrounding a
small grove of young date trees nearby in a pearly, silver glow. The
trees stand close the high, thick walls of Phatep just north of here.
Lanterns hang from the top of the wall, bathing the smooth stone in
an inviting yellow glow. The walls runs a short distance to the east
in the direction of the Kithan Mountain range that stands against the
starry backdrop of the sky some distance east, and west, towards the
gates of the city.

31004.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31004.description:
This is the southeastern corner of the City of Phatep. The huge wall
runs to the west from a huge tower that marks the corner. Another wall
runs north from the tower towards the eastern gate. A small trail follows
the north running wall, keeping close to the city. In all other directions
is the desert, though to the east, someway distant but looming large, is
the impressive sight of the Kithan Mountain range.

exdescs.desc_night:
A huge, circular tower topped with a crystal minaret forms the
southeastern corner of the City of Phatep. Torches are hung from
various levels on the tower but cast little light into the surrounding
darkness of the desert. The walls of the city run north and west from
the tower towards the north and west gates respectively. In all other
directions lies the Great Haran Desert, a vast expanse of golden sand
that stretches from Phatep, south to the Shagrim Hills.

31005.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31005.description:
The vast, seemingly endless sands of the Great Haranian Desert expand
south, east and west from this point. The golden sands glow like a sea
of gold in the heat of the day. To the north of here is the high, broad
stone walls of the City of Phatep. Guards patrol the top of the walls,
and each section is seperated by tall towers topped by the bulbous
minarets so loved by the Haran people. The gates of the city lie to the
east and north.

exdescs.desc_night:
Moonlight casts a wan, silvery glow over the vast, seemingly endless
sands of the Great Haranian desert that stretch out into the horizon
to the south, east and west. Almost directly north from here is the
high walls of the City of Phatep. The walls are broad and thick and
are broken at intervals by tall towers topped with sparkling minarets.
The soft moonlight sparkles on the pointed domes, making them gleam
like diamonds in the night. The gates to the city can be reached by
travelling east and north from this point.

31006.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31006.description:
A number of tall palm trees stand in a clustered group in the shadow of
the great wall of Phatep that stands to the north. The trees sway in the
desert breeze, casting dancing shadows across the sands of the desert and
the wall of the city. To the east, south and west lies the shimmering,
golden sands of the Great Desert of Haran. Some distance to the east, the
gates to the city can just be seen, set into the wall between two huge
towers and far beyond that, pale and hazy on the far horizon, are the
towering peaks of the Kithan Mountain range.

exdescs.desc_night:
The darkness of the night makes the golden, endless sands that stretch
away east, south and west, seem almost eerie. The moon casts its pale,
wan glow over everything, adding to the surreal quality of the surrounding.
A small bunch of palm trees stand beneath the great wall of Phatep that
is standing to the north. The trees shift in the breeze, creaking
ominously. The wall extends east, past two tall towers that mark the
gates of Phatep, and on around the rest of the city, and west.

31007.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31007.description:
A few unhealthy, scraggly plants grow in the shade of the massive wall
that surrounds the City of Phatep to the north. The walls are thick and
look almost impenetrable. Guards patrol the top of the wall, watching
the surrounding desert for signs of danger. The, vast, sandy expanse of
the desert stretches away into the horizon to the south, east and west,
like a golden brown sea of dunes and valleys.

exdescs.desc_night:
It is difficult to see in the near total darkness of the night, but
torches attached to scones at the top of the Phatep city walls to the
north, provide dim circles of light. The pearly glow of the moon adds
some small illumination, but it is a surreal light, making the sands
of the desert that stretch away to the east, west and south seem even
more beautiful and awe-inspiring than it is during the day.

31008.name: The Edge of the Great Desert
31008.description:
The sands of the Great Haranian desert expand outwards here to the
south and east like a golden carpet that is constantly shifting and
sliding. Large dunes have formed up against the massive walls of the
City of Phatep that stand to the north. The tall, circular tower that
forms the southwestern corner is half buried beneath the steep piles
of windblown sand. The walls continue to the north and east of the
tower. To the west, large clumps of jagged rocks stick up from the
sand making progress in that direction difficult.

exdescs.desc_night:
The sand shimmers with a pearl-like radience and a soft, metalic
quality in the pale glow of the moon. The silence of the desert that
expands to the east and south is broken only by the soft slithering
of the sand as it shifts and settles in new positions. The huge walls
of Phatep stand to the north, and run east and north from a circular
tower that forms the southwestern corner of the city. To the west,
beyond the edge of Phatep, the sandy desert gives way to jagged rocks
that stick up from the ground and make travel difficult.

31017.name: The Ruins of a Golden Tower
31017.description:
Golden sand dunes have piled up high against the stone base of what
was once an enormous golden tower. Much of the tower has been long
consumed by the desert, but there is still a great length reaching
up from the sea of sand, like a finger pointing to the heavens in
accusation. A crumbling shell of a minaret that once topped the tower
lies close by, weatherworn and faded but still remarkably maintaining
something of the magnificance it must once have worn. There are other
scattered ruins nearby, to the east and west, but beyond lies endless,
sun-baked desert.

exdescs.desc_night:
Pale moonlight slants down, covering the golden sands of the desert
in a soft, pearly radience. A tall tower rears up out of dunes of
sand that have piled up high around the base. The stone seems to
shimmer silver in the moonlight, as though made from metal instead
of the rough stone. The broken, crumbling shell of a toppled minaret
lies near to the tower, little more than a cracked shell. More
ruins lie to the east and west of the tower, while the seemingly
endless Haranian desert extends out in all other directions.

31018.name: Scattered Ruins
31018.description:
Ancient stone blocks, weatherworn, and beaten by time, lie sprawled
across this are of desert like a giant's discarded toys. A huge stone
head that is cracked and broken and crumbling into rubble, lies half
submerged in the sand; only and eye and part of the nose remains in
view. There is an eerie silence among these ruins, as though the
spirits of the long ago inhabitants still roam. The ruins extend
to the west, while the desert extends away in all other directions.

exdescs.desc_night:
The ruins that lie scattered around this section of the desert seem
surreal in the dim, silvery glow of the moonlight. A soft haze covers
everything, like a fine mist, and the sand slivers across the stonework
as though alive. A huge stone head lies half submerged in the sand
nearby. A single eye stares up from the sand, ghost-like and eerie in
the pearly radience cast by the moon. More ruins lie to the west of here
while the Great Desert extends out in all other directions.

31019.name: The Edge of the Ruins
31019.description:
Jumbled ruins lie scattered across the sand, or half buried beneath
it. The stone is golden, like the desert, and the structures must once
have been incredible to look at. Time has taken its toll, however, and
there is little here now but broken columns and crumbling statues with
little remaining above the sand. Beyond the ruins to the west, in the
distance, the desert comes to an end at a long line of jagged rocks,
beyond which lies the sparkling blue of the ocean. The desert lies
past the ruins to the east, north and south.

exdescs.desc_night:
The silvery moonlight slants down from the night sky, bathing the
scattered ruins that lie in various states of decay across this small
section of desert. Rough stone blocks, half buried in the sand, glow
with the soft, pearly radience of the moon. It is obvious that the
ruins have been here for a great many years; the stone is rough and
crumbling, and the desert sands have consumed many of the structures,
burying them beneath heaped dunes. More ruines lie to the east, while
some way to the west, beyond a long, thin line of jagged rocks is the
ocean, glowing like a vast carpet of liquid silver in the moonlight.

31020.name: A Sand Covered, Broken Courtyard
31020.description:
The remains of an ancient stone courtyard lies buried beneath the desert
here, though patches of smooth stone can still be seem, poking up
through breaks in the sand. Remarkably, a large archway, made from
the same brown and gold coloured stone, still stands, arching across
the courtyard and looking strangely out of place against the backdrop
of the desert. More ruins are north and northwest of here, while some
way to the east is the ocean, twinkling in the bright desert sunlight.

exdescs.desc_night:
An ancient stone courtyard pokes up through the sand, the smooth,
sand-polished stone glowing softly in the ghost-like pearly glow of
the moon. A large archway, made from the same type of stone as the
rest of the ruins, arches across the courtyard. It is a strange sight
against the backdrop of the desert, made even more surreal in the
moonlight, which makes even the most mundane of things seem unusual.
More of the ruins lie to the northeast and north of here, while some
distance to the west, the vast expanse of the ocean can be seen.

31023.name: The Entrance to the Bendoumi Camp
31023.description:
A large, bustling camp has been set up here, on the edge of a small
complex of ancient ruins. The main part of the camp is south, between
two flag poles that have been stuck in the ground. Two crossed scimitars
form the simple symbol that is printed on the brightly coloured flags.
A crumbling wall blocks any access to the ruins north, but there is a
partly buried courtyard to the west which seems to give access to the
rest of the ruins.

exdescs.desc_night:
A large, bustling, apparently permanent campsite has been set up here
on the edge of a series of crumbling ruins. The moonlight surrounds the
camp in a soft haze, shining of the soft canvas of the brightly coloured
tents. The glow of a large fire can be seen in the main part of the camp
to the south. A long wall blocks entrance to the ruins to the north, but
it looks possible to gain access to the complex by way of a partly buried
courtyard that lies to the west.

31024.name: The Bendoumi Camp
31024.description:
Although not huge, this camp is still a fair size, and seems to bustle
with activity day and night as the Bendoumi nomads work at their appointed
tasks. A large canvas tent stands to the east. It is a bright blue, and a
fluttering banner is impaled in the sand outside the flap. The centre of
the camp is to the south, surrounded by a jumble of tents of various
shapes, sizes and colours. The main entrance to the camp is to the north
of here, between to fluttering flag poles.

exdescs.desc_night:
A number of torches stand outside the various camps, giving light
to the camp during the dark hours. Even during the night, the camp
is a hive of activity, and it seems as though the place is never silent.
A large tent stands to the east. Moonlight shines on the smooth canvas,
giving it a beautiful silvery glow. A proud banner flutters from a pole
outside the flap. The central portion of the camp is to the south, while
the main entrance is to the north.

31025.name: Outside the Goat Pen
31025.description:
The unwholesome stench of animal droppings drifts across on the desert
breeze from the west, where a large, fenced enclosure houses a sizeable
herd of bleating goats. The wooden fence protecting the herd is made from
the trunks of date and palm trees that are easily obtainable in certain
parts of the desert and the Shagrim Hills to the south. The sand has been
cleared somewhat to provide a simple trail back into the heart of the
Bendoumi camp to the east.

exdescs.desc_night:
The slanted, silvery rays of moonlight cast a soft, pearly haze over
a nearby fenced enclosure containing a large herd of bleating goats.
The smell of animal droppings is excruciatingly strong, and seems to
fill the air even when there is no breeze. The fence is made from the
palm and date trees that dot certain parts of the desert, and in greater
quantities the Shagrim Hills. A path has been cleared in the sand to
the east, leading between two tents into the heart of the Bendoumi
camp.

31026.name: The Calif's Tent
31026.description:
This is a large, spacious tent, sumptuously decorated with fine silks
and carpets that hang from the walls, displaying the obvious wealth of
the tent's owner. Cushions and velvet pillows are heaped everywhere
and the heady scent of perfume and incense fills the air. A large,
comfortable bed fills the far wall. It is heaped with cushions and
soft, silken sheets. The entrance to the tent is a flap on the south
wall which leads out into the camp.

31027.name: The Bendoumi Well
31027.description:
The sand has been cleared as best it can from this central portion of
the camp and a stone well has been built. A number of tents stand in no
particular order around the camp. Each one is a a bright colour and no
two appear the same shape or size. There is a small opening between two
of the tents running east, out of the camp, while the entrance to other
tents can be reached to the north and south.

exdescs.desc_night:
The moonlight slants down from the night sky, illuminating this central
part of the Bendoumi camp with a soft, silver glow. A large, circular
well stands nearby, providing much needed water to the nomads, while
all around are clustered various tents of bright colours. The entrance
flaps to several of these tents can be reached to the north and south,
while a small opening between two of them leads out of the camp to the
east. A number of torches nearby provide much needed light to the camp.

31028.name: The Bendoumi Camp
31028.description:
This is the southernmost part of the Bendoumi nomad camp. Two large,
canvas tents stand to the east and west. The tents are painted in
bright colours - red and green - and banners flutter from poles
outside the flaps. A large stone well stands to the north, in the
central portion of the camp, and from somewhere beyond that, the
sound of goats bleating can be heard.

exdescs.desc_night:
Moonlight slants down through the camp, highlighting two large tents
that stand to the east and west here. Banners outside the entrance
flaps flutter proudly in the desert breeze. The central part of the
camp is to the north, where the circular stone outline of a well can
be seen, silhouetted in the silvery glow of the moon. Beyond the well,
the soft sound of bleating can be heard.

31029.name: The Goat Pen
31029.description:
This is a small, fenced enclosure used to house the goat herd of the
Bendoumi tribe. Most of the sand has been cleared from the hard earth
to provide a comfortable environment for the animals and small handfulls
of grass have been scattered across the enclosure. The wooden gate is to
the east and the enclosure extends further to the south.

31030.name: Between Two Tents
31030.description:
This is a small gap between two large, colourful tents in the Bendoumi
nomad camp. To the east, past the canvas sided walls on either side, is
the vast expanse of the Great Desert. The main part of the camp is to
the west. It is bustling and busy at all times of the day, with nomads
keeping active with their various tasks.

31031.name: The Sheikh's Tent
31031.description:
This is a huge, brightly lit tent. Numerous ornate iron lanterns
hang from hooks on the canvas walls, sending bright beams of light
across the luxuriously outfitted interior. A huge bundle of comfortable,
colourful cushions occupy a large corner of the room and against the
eastern wall is a large divan covered with exquisite satin sheets. A
beautifully crafted chest made from solid oak - a extreme rarity in
the desert - lies against the opposite wall. The entrance to the tent
is through a flap on the western wall.

exdescs.divan:
This is a comfortable looking couch, plumped high with cushions and
embroidered with sequined buttons.

31032.name: The Wazir's Tent
31032.description:
The inside of this large tent is dark and roomy. The air is smoky from
the brazier and smells heavily of incense. There is a small hole in the
roof of the tent to allow the smoke to clear, but it does not appear
to be doing a very good job. A thick wooden support pole stands in the
very centre of the tent. The pole is decorated with various skins and
feathers and other things less pleasant. A heap of colourful cushions
lie in the far corner and a comfortable pallet rests against the
northern wall, serving as a bed. The tent flap is to the east.

31049.name: The Hephet Oasis
31049.description:
This is a small oasis, made up of a single, tiny pool of refreshing water,
sitting like a mirage in the middle of the sand. Amazingly, green grass
grows at the poolside, the ground fed by the water so that it becomes
fertile. A single palm tree overlooks the oasis, offering shade during
the daylight hours. There is also a shelf like rock jutting out over the
water, providing a place to rest and relax.

exdescs.desc_night:
Soft, tranquil moonlight bathes this small oasis in a silver glow,
turning the peaceful waters into molten silver. It is quiet and serene
here and the only sound is the soft swish of the desert breeze through
the grass at the poolside, and the gentle tinkling of the waters against
the rock that overhangs the pool like a ledge. A single palm tree hangs
over the water, swaying slightly in the breeze.

31050.name: An Outcropping of Rocks
31050.description:
A huge outcropping of rocks stands here, like some giants plaything that
has been dropped amongst the sands and dunes of the Desert. The peak of
the rocks juts into the air, looking very much like a finger pointing to
the sky. Everywhere else, as far as the eye can see, there is the soft,
golden, shifting sands of the Great Haran Desert.

31056.name: North of a Temple
31056.description:
The sands of the desert have been cleared here, to allow the construction
of what appears to be a temple complex that stands just south of here.
It appears to be a jumble of desert tents and huts, though with the
feeling of permanence about it. Everywhere else, there is only the sands
of the desert, stretching away to the east, north and west of here.

31057.name: Demon's Tor
31057.description:
This is a huge rock, shaped at this end like the sharper end of a
chicken egg. It is a dull brown colour, darker than the sands of the
desert that surround it and looking out of place. It is weather beaten
and gouged in many places by the harsh assaults of the elements. The
rock continues to the east, but everywhere else is the golden sands of
the Great Haranian Desert.

31058.name: Demon's Tor
31058.description:
This is a huge rock, partly buried under the ever shifting sands of the
desert. The surface of the rock is marked and scoured by the constantly
harsh weather conditions and the ceaseless assault of the elements. It
seems very out of place among the golden sea of sand that surrounds it,
almost as though some giant hand picked it up and threw it across the
world.

exdescs.rock:
The surface of the rock is marked and pitted from the constantly blowing wind of the
desert. The indentions look like they may make good hand or footholds should someone
want to try to climb to the top of the rock.

31063.name: North of a Temple
31063.description:
A few lonely looking palm trees stand here, overlooking the low walls
of a temple that stands to the south. The temple is little more than
a jumble of tents and huts, but it has the feeling of permanence, a
feeling that is enhanced by the many nomads that seem to be busy in
the grounds. In all other directions there is nothing but the golden
sands of the desert.

31065.name: West of a Temple
31065.description:
To the east of here is a low wall that surrounds a small temple complex,
built in the centre of the great desert. The complex is a small gathering
of huts and tents but has a permanent quality about it. In all other
directions stretches the Great desert, a seemingly endless stretch of
golden sand and dunes.

31066.name: North of a Temple
31066.description:
A low, sandstone wall surrounds a small temple complex that sits amidst
the sands of the desert to the south. The wall does not seem built to
keep anyone out, rather, it seems more suitable as added protection
against the harsh elements and sandstorms of the Great Desert which
extends away from here in most directions.

31067.name: Outside a Temple
31067.description:
The low walls of a small, but busy temple complex stand to the south
of here. A number of nomads seem to be busy within the walls, but
there is little to determine what the purpose of the place is. The
Great Desert expands out from the walls like a great sea of shifting,
golden sands.

31068.name: The Goat Pen
31068.description:
This is the fenced enclosure that houses the goat herd of the Bendoumi
tribe when the animals are not out grazing at one of the few oasis that
are scattered about the desert. A few palm and date trees occupy one
corner of the enclosure, providing some shade for the animals. The
rest of the fenced section is to the north as well as the entrance gate.

31069.name: The Supply Tent
31069.description:
This is a small, unfurnished tent used to house the various supplies
needed for the nomads. Sacks of grain, traded in the bazaars of Phatep
and Shagrim are stacked in piles around the room as well as barrels of
goat's milk, mead and water. Also among the supplies are bags of dates
and other fruits that grow in the desert. A small flap on the northern
wall leads back out into the desert.

31075.name: South of a Temple
31075.description:
A scattering of tents and huts to the north make up some kind of small
temple complex that is surrounded by a low wall of sandstone that helps
to protect the inhabitants from sandstorms and the harsh elements of the
desert. The sands of the desert extend away from the walls to the south
and west, while the walls of the temple continue to the east.

31076.name: South of a Temple
31076.description:
A small temple complex stands north of here, looking strange and out
of place amidst the bleak sands. A low sandstone wall surrounds the
complex, offering some small protection against the elements of the
desert. The complex is made up of tents and huts, though it is busy
and has an air of permanence.

31092.name: A Rocky Ridge
31092.description:
A large ridge of sandstone blocks any further progress to the south
or southeast. The face of the stone has been cut and sculpted so
that it shows the face of some great leader. The ridge extends to the
east, and in all other directions there is nothing but the sand of the
Great Desert.

31093.name: A Rocky Ridge
31093.description:
This is the end of a rocky ridge, which tapers to a few tall columns of
rock east of here. A pathway leads off to the southeast into the foothills
that surround the eastern edge of the desert. The golden sands of the
desert stretch outwards from here to the north and west, like an unending
sea that is constantly shifting in the desert breeze.

exdescs.columns:
Upon closer inspection of the rock columns, one of them appears
to have a crack in its surface that could possibly be an
entrance into the depths of the column.
exdescs.rock:
Upon closer inspection of the rock columns, one of them appears
to have a crack in its surface that could possibly be an
entrance into the depths of the column.
exdescs.tall:
Upon closer inspection of the rock columns, one of them appears
to have a crack in its surface that could possibly be an
entrance into the depths of the column.

31095.name: Outside the Alari Camp
31095.description:
The sand has been cleared here to form a crude path. Slabs of heavy stone
mark the path east into what looks like a small but bustling nomad camp.
Dull brown, semi-permanent huts known as yurts and a jumble of red and
orange tents form the bulk of the camp. A flag pole bearing a fluttering
banner has been stuck in the ground at the edge of the path showing a
picture of a racing camel and the word Alari. To the north and west lies
the unchanging vastness of the Haranian desert.

exdescs.desc_night:
Flickering torches cast dancing shadows across the dark backs of nearby
tents that form a small camp to the east. The sand has been cleared away
to form a crude path leading into the camp, and soft moonlight help
illuminate the thick, heavy slabs that have been lain. A banner that has
been atached to a pole and stuck in the ground flutters in the desert
breeze. It is not possible in the dark to see what, if anything, is
printed on the banner.

31096.name: Outside the Seeker's Hut
31096.description:
This is close to the entrance of the Alari nomad camp. The sand has been
cleared away and numerous tents have been pitched around a central gathering
area that stands to the south of here. To the east stands a large hut
known as a yurt. It is circular and made from a wooden frame with animal
hides stretched and treated with hardening oils. The empty expanse of the
Great Haran desert stretches away to the west, the golden sands gleaming
in the desert sun.

exdescs.desc_night:
The dark shadow of a large yurt stands to the east. Moonlight slants
down between broken clouds, illuminating the semi-permanent structure
against the dark backdrop of the desert. It is made from a wooden frame
with skins stretched over it and hardened. The main part of the Alari
camp is to the south, where a number of tents are clustered around a
central gathering area. The desert is to the west.

31097.name: The Seeker's Hut
31097.description:
This is a large yurt that is sparsely decorated. Skins from camels and
other animals native to Haran hang from the walls, along with unusual
items that do not seem to have any recognisable purpose. The entire
room is filled with a faint mist that emanates from various candles
scaterred across the floor, and the smell is intoxicating. There is
a circular pit dug in the centre of the room for a fire, and a hole in
the roof allows the smoke to escape. The only door from the yurt is
on the southern wall.

31098.name: The Alari Camp
31098.description:
This is the centre of a small, but busy, camp in the desert. Tents and
the semi-permanent huts known as yurts stand in a small cluster around
this central gathering area. The largest tent is to the south and there
is another entrance flap to the east. A thick pole of wood has been
impaled in the ground and a banner flaps from the top of it bearing the
symbol of a black horse rearing up on its hind legs. The camp extends
to the west, and the entrance to the camp lies north of here.

exdescs.desc_night:
Moonlight breaks through the thin layer of clouds in the dark sky and
sends shafts of silvery light down to illuminate this central portion
of the Alari camps. Tents and the semi-permanent yurts stand in a loose
cluster all around here. The biggest is to the south, and stands as a
dark outline against the dark backdrop of the desert. Another tent flap
is to the east. The camp extends further west, in the direction of an
oasis, while the entrance to the camp is to the north.

31099.name: The Sheikh's Harem
31099.description:
The interior of this gaudily coloured tent is large and roomy and filled
with the strong, heady smell of the many scented candles that are ranged
around the walls. It is extravagantly decorated in exquisite silks and
colourful cloths that hang from the ceiling and the central pole. A huge
pile of cushions covers most of the floor, along with soft, comfortable
divans, and low benches covered in soft velvet and thick pillows. Lamps
attached to the top of the walls provide welcome light. A large flap to
the west leads out from the tent.

31100.name: The Alari Camp
31100.description:
This is the edge of the Alari camp. The sand has been clearing to create
a large space infront of the council tent that stands to the south. West of
here is the oasis, which provides fruit and water for the Alari tribe.
The main part of the camp stands to the east, surrounded by a cluster of
tents and semi-permanent huts known as Yurts

exdescs.desc_night:
Away from the main part of the camp, it is dark and there are only a
few shafts of eerie, silver moonlight to illuminate the area. A large
tent stands to the south of here and dim yellow lanterns hang outside
the flap, casting dancing shadows across the canvas walls. There is an
oasis to the west and main part of the Alari camp is to the east.

31101.name: Sheikh Rashid-el-Alari's Tent
31101.description:
The interior of this large tent is dark and somewhat dingy due to the
thin mist of grey smoke that issues up from the various hubble bubble
pipes and scented candles that are ranged across the floor. A large,
cushioned divan rests against the far wall and the floor around the
divan is covered in velvet pillows. The centre of the tent has been
hollowed out and a large bath has been sunken into the ground. The
water looks refreshing against the heat of the desert, and the smooth
surface is scattered with rose petals. The tent flap is to the north.

31102.name: The Council Tent
31102.description:
This is a large, spacious tent. The floor is covered in a thick reed
mat and colourful hides hang from the walls as decoration. Low, wooden
benches form a half circle at the far end of the room, partly surrounding
a table that fills up the middle of the tent. Lamps hang from the walls
and the central support that cuts through the middle of the table. The
only way out of the tent is through the flap on the north wall.

31103.name: The Alari Oasis
31103.description:
This is a small slice of paradise among the vast, endless sands of the
Great Haran Desert that stretch away to the north and west. Palm trees
grow tall, swaying in the breeze and overhanging a sparkling oasis of
crystal clear water. A large pillar of rock rises up in the centre of
the pool, entwined with green vines that look out of place even in this
beautiful place. A grove of date trees offer shade to the south of
here and the Alari nomad's camp is to the east.

31104.name: The Alari Oasis
31104.description:
Date trees stand in a cluster around the pool of crystal clear water
that is the dominant feature of this peaceful, tranquil oasis. The
trees groan softly as they bend in the desert breeze, and the shade
is refreshing and cool after the overpowering heat of the desert sands.
The oasis stretches to the north where is joins the edge of a nomad
camp. The Great Desert of Haran stretches away in all other directions.

31110.name: The Djinn's Teeth
31110.description:
This jagged line of rocks is known as The Djinn's Teeth and form a
barrier between the sands of the Great Desert which stretch away into
the distance to the east and southeast, and the waters of the ocean
that can be seen glistening in the distance to the west. A pathway has
been carved into the rocks that leads to the west, and leads down to a
patch of beach at the base of the rocks.

exdescs.desc_night:
Starlight briefly illumintes the jagged, sharp rocks that run in a
crooked line north and south of here. Bits of broken wood lie
scattered among the spikes of rock where ships have run aground on
the treacherous coast in the past. To the east, pale moonlight
slants down, flshing on the sands that are golden brown during the
daylight hours, but shimmer like silver during the night. The walls
of the city of Phatep stand just north of the desert sands, and they
are lit with dim oil lamps that hang from the top of the battlements.

31111.name: The Djinn's Teeth
31111.description:
This is a long line of sharp rocks known as The Djinn's Teeth. Travel
here is extremely hazardous and one wrong foot or a slip could mean
instant death by impalement on any of the many spears of stone. The
sands of the desert expand eastwards into the far distance, like a sea
of gold, sparkling in the bright light of the sun. Some way west, beyond
the Teeth, lies the endless waters of the ocean, sunsparkled and gleaming
like a carpet of diamonds.

exdescs.desc_night:
The soft pearly radience of the moonlight and the silvery glow of the
stars above do little to alleviate the sharp angles and jagged look
of this barrier of rocks that seperates the desert from the waters of
the ocean some way west. If anything, the shimmering glow of the moon
adds a surreal, sinister aspect to the unturned spears of stone. Walking
here is difficult and hazardous, and the route south or north must be
picked with care to avoid impalement.

31112.name: The Djinn's Teeth
31112.description:
This is the edge of a long barrier of jacked rocks that stick up from
earth, forming a treacherous stretch of land between the ocean to the
west and the great desert that stretches away to the east. The rocks
continue to the west, but to the south is the start of a scattered
series of ruins. The Djinn's Teeth, as the rocks are known, also
expand north from here, in the direction of Phatep, and the tail end
of the Kithan Mountains far north.

exdescs.desc_night:
The jagged rocks that form this long barrier between the ocean and the
sands of the desert are known as the Djinn's Teeth, after the powerful
desert dwelling spirit, the Djinn. The moonlight gives the rocks a surreal,
spectral quality, that make them appear unnatural. Just south of here is
a scattered ruin and the vast, seemingly endless sands of the Great Desert
expand east from here into the distance.

31123.name: A Huge Wasp Nest
31123.description:
The sand is piled into an immense dune here, and at the top, is a huge
wasp nest. The nest is oval shaped and a slightly darker shade of yellow
than the sand it rests on. Circular openings all around the nest allow
entry and exit to the wasps. A loud, constant buzzing echoes from within
the structure. To the east and northeast there is nothing but sand. To the
west is a massive rocky ridge blocking any further travel in that direction.
The crashing of the ocean waves can just be heard from beyond the ridge,
barely discernible over the sound of the wasps.

exdescs.desc_night:
Moonlight illuminates a huge pile of sand that has been massed into
an immense dune. The sand gleams like silver and shifts gently under
the weight of a huge, oval shaped wasp's nest that is perched on the
summit. Like everything else in the desert at night, the nest is little
more than a blob of darkness, surrounded by a pale, pearly glow from
the moon and starlight. A loud, constant buzz echoes from within the
nest, and darker circles can just be seen where the wasps enter and
exit. In most directions there is nothing but desert, but any travel
to the west is blocked by a massive ridge of stone. The sound of waves
crashing against rock can be heard from beyond the barrier, indicating
that the ocean is hidden just out of view.

31129.name: A Sandy Trail
31129.description:
This is a narrow, sand-covered trail that follows the wall of the
City of Phatep to the north, in the direction of the city gates, and
south, towards the heart of the Great Desert that stretches away into
the horizon. More of the desert extends east from here, before meeting
up with the Kithan mountain ranges some distance away. The walls of
Phatep are huge and impossing, and look more than capable of deterring
any invaders.

31130.name: A Sandy Trail Around the City
31130.description:
This is a narrow trail, half-buried beneath the sands of the desert,
that follows the eastern wall of Phatep as it runs in a north-south
direction. The sands of the desert stretch away from here to the east
and south, but it has been somewhat tamed here near the city and a
grove of palm and date trees grow nearby in the shade of the wall.
Further east, past the borders of the desert, lie the high peaks of
the Kithan Mountain Range.

31131.name: A Sandy Trail
31131.description:
A clump of boulders sit off to the side of the trail here, offering a
limited shade during the day. A palm tree grows in amongst the clump
casting a shadow over the wall of the City of Phatep that stands to
the west and runs north and south. The path follows the wall north
as far as the gates and also south, where it eventually merges with
the sands of the Great Desert.

31142.name: The Merchant Caravan
31142.description:
This is the start of what appears to be a small merchant train. Despite
the fact that trains through the desert are intended to make the journey
quicker, this one does not appear to be moving. The sand has been cleared
and several tents have been pitched, making this a semi permanent camp.
There is no sign of water nearby however and only a few stunted palm
trees seem to offer any kind of shade.

31143.name: The Merchant Caravan
31143.description:
This is the central portion of a merchant caravan. Here things look a
little settled and a number have tents have been pitched for shelter.
It is a very exposed part of the desert and there is little shade or
protection from the elements to be found, making it a poor choice for
a campsite. The end of the caravan is to the east and the front is to
the west.

31144.name: The Merchant Caravan
31144.description:
This is the rear end of the merchant caravan. Empty crates, boxes,
and sacks lie scattered across the sand. Some are still full, but
they are far fewer than the full ones. Barrels also stand among the
empty packaging, and these most likely contain water. The main part
of the merchant caravan is to the west. In all other directions there
is nothing but sand.

31145.name: The Head Merchant's Tent
31145.description:
Though larger than most, this tent is still fairly small, and obviously
not meant to be used as a permanent abode. The interior is a mass of
scattered boxes and parchments. A large matress occupies the far wall
and a makeshift desk sits in the middle of the room, made from the wood
of several palm trees. The only way out of the tent is through a flap on
the north wall.

31149.name: The Scorpion Nest
31149.description:
A large outcropping of rocks forms the base for a huge mass of leaves
and stones and twigs all mashed together and covered in a sticky resin
to create a nest. A few scattered bones of desert creatures lie in a
scattered jumble around the base of the rocks. Blood splatters cover
some of the stones, turning them an ugly, dull red. The smell is
terrible, bringing to mind death and decay. To the south and southwest
is the golden, gleaming sands of the great desert.

31161.name: The Copper Dunes
31161.description:
Strange, heaped dunes of copper coloured sand extends south and east
from here, stretching some distance. The grains of sand seem thicker,
almost like rust and there is a strange smell in the air, like ancient
metal. Walking on the sand is more difficult than normal, making travel
slower and more tiring. There are no trees or any other form of life in
view. The normal, golden sands of the desert stretch away to the west
from here.

exdescs.desc_night:
The pearl-like glow of moonbeams slant down from the dark sky casting
a glow over the mounds of unusual sand that are heaped up here. The
sand seems to swallow the light, and glow with an eerie, fire-like
quality that is unnerving and surreal. Nothing seems to grow in this
section of the desert and there is an ominous silence over everything.
The sands to the west of here seem closer to normal and are suffused
a silvery sparkle from the moon and stars.

31162.name: The Copper Dunes
31162.description:
Walking on this strange, metallic sand is very difficult as anything
touching it seems inclined to sink deeply below the surface and not
want to come out again. The coppery coloured dunes shift constantly
into new shapes and sizes, even into near mountains of firey red
look almost impossible. The strange dunes continue to the south east
and west from here.

exdescs.desc_night:
Nothing grows in this desolate wasteland of coppery dunes. Walking on
the metallic sand is very difficult as anything with any weight seems
to sink deep into the constanly shifting dunes. The moonlight makes
the landscape grow with a strange, firey red, as though it is alight.
The strange coppery landscape continues from here to the north, west
and south.

31163.name: The Copper Dunes
31163.description:
These strange, copper coloured dunes of heaped sand make a strange
clanking sound as they shift beneath their own weight. It is a
disconcerting feeling, and the sound is not pleasant. Walking on
the dunes is very difficult as it does not seem firmly packed like
the rest of the desert, and any weight sinks deep below the surface.
The dunes continue to the south and west.

exdescs.desc_night:
A strange sound echoes from the metalic sands of these coppery dunes,
moving across the dark desert landscape like the mournful howl of the
dead. The soft glow of the moon highlights the crimson quality of
the unusual sand and adds another layer to the eerie, surreal quality
of the place. The sands expand to the south and west from here.

31164.name: The Copper Dunes
31164.description:
A low, hollow-sounding wind whistles through these strange dunes, and
the sand seems to resonate when it is touched, emitting a soft but
distinct ringing sound that is eerie and disquieting. Nothing seems
to grow among these dunes, and the whole stretch of desert seems
mournful and quiet. The coppery sands extend to the north, east and
south from here.

exdescs.desc_night:
A low dip in the dunes here picks up the strange sound that is produced
when the wind whistles across the sand and distorts it, making it sound
for all the world like the wail of a banshee, or some other lost soul in
pain and torment. It is an ominous, eerie sound, made all the more disturbing
by the unusual surroundings that glow a deep crimson in the light of the
moon. The desert continues to the north, south, east and west, though
the coppery dunes go no further west.

31165.name: The Copper Dunes
31165.description:
The eerie quiet and monotonous desolation of this strange section of
desert is unnerving and more than a little frightening. Nothing grows
here and the shifting of the copper coloured sand creates a low, mournful
ringing sound that is almost painful to listen to. The strange dunes
continue to the north, east, west and south from here.

exdescs.desc_night:
The moonlight does strange things to the copper coloured sand that is
heaped into large dunes in this section of the desert. It glows like
fire, a surreal sight in the darkness, making it seem as though the
horizon is burning. The strange sands extend from here to the north,
east, south and west.

31166.name: The Copper Dunes
31166.description:
A tall metal pole rears up out of the coppery sands here, soaring to
several spans high. The pole is rusting and weathered, but still
seems capable of bearing a great deal of punishment from the elements.
It is an odd sight to see among the sands of the desert, but strangely
acceptable against the metalic, copper coloured dunes.

exdescs.desc_night:
Pale, shimmering pools of silvery moonlight flicker across the length
of a tall metal pole that soars up into the air from the coppery sands
to a height of several spans. It is an odd sight to see in the desert, but
seems somehow at home among the unusal dunes. The pole is rusting and
worn, but still strong and hardy. The strange dunes continue in all
directions from here.

31167.name: The Copper Dunes
31167.description:
This is the edge of a series of strange, copper coloured dunes that
continue to the north and east from here. The dunes have a curious
metallic quality and they crunch underfoot with a loud ringing sound.
Nothing seems to grow among the dunes, and there is no living thing
in sight. Walking is also difficult on the unusual sand, as it shits
and slides underfoot.

exdescs.desc_night:
This is the edge of a series of strange, copper coloured dunes that
glow like fire in the pale light of the moon, making it seem as though
the horizon to the east and north is ablaze. The odd dunes have a
metallic quality that makes them crunch underfoot and emit a whistling
ring when the wind blows across them. Walking is very difficult as the
sand constantly shifts and slides underfoot.

31168.name: The Copper Dunes
31168.description:
Strange shards of jagged coppery metal jut up from the dunes here,
glittering like knives in the desert sun. They look odd and out of place
even among the metalic, copper coloured sand dunes that extend from
here to the north, south, east and west. There is an eerie silence
in this unusual part of the desert, as though nothing living dares
to wander here.

exdescs.desc_night:
The dim glow of the stars and the soft, pale light of the moon cast
dancing shadows across the sharp, jagged shards of copper coloured
metal that jut up from the dunes here. They glow like fire wherever the
light touches, and the wind whistling among them sets them vibrating
with a musical, metal ringing sound. The strange dunes extend from here
in all directions.

31169.name: The Copper Dunes
31169.description:
Nothing grows among these strange dunes of copper coloured sand, nor is
there any sign of rocks or anything else to break to eerie monotony
of the unusual surroundings. The odd sand is difficult to walk on, as
it constantly shifts underfoot, causing legs to sink in almost to knee
height. The dunes stretch away to the north, west and south from here.

exdescs.desc_night:
There is little light to illuminate the eerie surroundings of the copper
dunes, but what little moonlight slants dwon from above, casts its hand
across the desert, causing the strange sand to glow a fiery red, as though
ablaze. Nothing grows here, and there are no rocks or other landmarks to
break the strange, monotonous surroundings.

31185.name: Within the Wasp's Nest
31185.description:
This is the interior of a huge wasp nest. A constant, echoing buzz
rebounds around the room, filling the air. There is a strong smell
covering everything, but it is unidentifiable. The only way out is
the same way as coming int, through one of the small holes high on
the walls of the nest.

31186.name: A Sandy Trail
31186.description:
There are a few patches of yellow, stunted grass stalks growing at the
side of the path here, where the desert is beginning to taper to an
end further north. The trail follows the desert and the Walls of Phatep
to the north and south. Some distance north, the gates of the city can
just be seen, and in the distance, to the east, stands the great peaks
of the Kithan Mountain range.

31195.name: The Copper Dunes
31195.description:
Here the bizarre, copper coloured sands that stretch north and east,
merge with the soft golden sands of the desert that strange away to the
west. The strange dunes are difficult to walk on, and any weight seems to
sink down below the surface. Nothing grows here and there are nor rocks
or living things to be seen.

exdescs.desc_night:
Strange, copper coloured dunes rise and fall like waves in the sea to
the north and east of here, and merge with the more normal looking,
golden coloured sands of the Great Desert that stretch away to the west.
Soft moonlight lies like a blanket over everything, and though they
give some small illumination over the sands to the west, they cause
the coppery dunes to glow with a strong, firey red.

31196.name: The Copper Dunes
31196.description:
Three unusual metal pyramids, some two spans high, rise up from the
coppery sands of the desert, like ancient black monoliths. There does
not appear to be any sign of rust or wear on the unusual objects, and
the harsh environment of the desert seems to have little effect on them.
Each of the them are topped with a small cone of shimmering quartz that
captures the sunlight and sends it glittering outwards in thousands of
small, bright shafts of white.

exdescs.desc_night:
Three black, metal pyramids, each some two spans high, rise up from the
curious coppery sands of the desert. They look like ancient black
monoliths, though they show no signs of wear or rust, despite being
built in the middle of a harsh desert environment. Each pyramid is
topped with a tiny cone of quartz. Each cone seems to absorb the light
and refract it up into the night sky, but the central one sends a single,
strong beam of light down so that is strikes the sand directly infront
of it.

31205.name: Within a Tall Rock Column
31205.description:
By the light filtering in through the crack in the wall,
it can be seen that this cave is not very large. There are
signs that this cave has been used in the recent past.
A burnt out fire is in a pit in the corner and what looks
like the bone remains of a meal are littered on the ground.
Perhaps this small cave provides shelter for those caught
in the desert when one of the frequent dust storms flair up.

31213.name: A Sandy Trail
31213.description:
the path can barely be seen here, beneath the wind blown sand that has
piled up here against the wall of Phatep to the west. Luckily, it is
an easy matter to follow the length of the wall, which runs to the
north and south. The desert stretches away to the east, until it meets
the base of the Kithan mountains.

31214.name: A Sandy Trail
31214.description:
The land is more rugged here as the desert gradually tapers out to
the north, and a line of palm trees have been planted alongside the
trail as it continues north towards the gate. The trail also runs to
the south from here, towards the southern wall of Phatep, and on where
it merges with the sands of the Great Desert.

31215.name: A Sandy Trail
31215.description:
A few prickly cactus grow close to the trail here, near where some of
the waste water from Phatep flows out through a small culvert in the
bottom of the wall. The water, although adding some small nourishment
to the earth is brakish and not pleasant to smell. The walls of the
city run north to the gates, and south to the southeastern corner of
the city.

31216.name: A Sandy Trail
31216.description:
Loose rocks and grit litter this narrow trail, indicating that the
relatively loose sands of the desert are gradually fading away to be
replaced by the rocky ground of the mountains that stand to the east.
The walls of the City of Phatep run on a north and south line here,
alongside the trail. The gates stand some distance to the north.

31217.name: A Sandy Trail
31217.description:
Yellow, fading grass verges this sandy trail, and a grove of palm trees
stand not far from the path, casting a welcome shade. To the west stands
the tall, thick walls of the City of Phatep. The sounds of the city can
be plainly heard, drifting over the walls as a general hubbub. The
gates to the city are a short distance north of here, while the trail
continues to the south, eventually merging into the sands of the desert.

31218.name: A Sandy Trail
31218.description:
Just north of here, this sandy trail merges with the larger, more worn
trail that leads away from the city east, and up into the Kithan
Mountain range. The gates can be seen clearly from here, and they
stand tall and sturdy between two tall towers topped with the dome-like
minarets that are popular among the people of Haran. The sands of the
desert expand south and east from here, and the trail follows the walls
of the city south until it eventually merges with the desert sands.

31219.name: The Copper Caverns
31219.description:
This is a dark, underground cavern that glows with a faint coppery light.
Metal shards pierce the ceiling in many places, some of them reaching
almost to the sandy floor below. The stone walls are silent and cold
and not even the sound of dripping water breaks the ominous quiet.
There is a circular opening in the ceiling. It is small and covered
in a thick mat of sand the is packed tight, stopping it from falling
through. Tunnels lead from here to the north, south, east and west.

31220.name: The Copper Caverns
31220.description:
A Pair of thick copper doors stand to the north of here, blocking any
further progress in that direction. There are no handles on the doors
and no obvious way through. A curly, smooth engraving decorates both
halves of the door, and small, gently glowing jewels are embedded in
the edges. The walls of this small passage glow with a dim copper colour,
as though the walls are filled with metal. The passage leads south into
a large central chamber.

31221.name: The Copper Caverns
31221.description:
Any futher passage to the south is blocked by a pair of semi-circular
bronze doors that block the entire tunnel. The surface of the doors are
engraved with curious designs that consists of swirls and circles in
intricate detail. Small gems are imprinted into the metal around the
edges and these glow with a soft inner light. The tunnel leads back
to the north, where it merges with the large central chamber.

31222.name: The Copper Caverns
31222.description:
This small passage ends quite abruptly here at a wall of solid rock.
The rock is embedded with what appears to be copper ingots, that glow
with some inner light. It is cold down here in the tunnels, but it is
not moist, perhaps due to the incredible heat of the desert above. The
tunnel runs west from here, into the main portions of the cave.

31223.name: The Copper Caverns
31223.description:
This is a large, spherical chamber that has been hollowed out of the
solid rock. The floor is sandy and littered with loose rocks and stones.
A passage leads east, back into the central part of the cave. Any further
progress to the west is blocked by a large rockfall that completely
blocks the tunnel. A tiny gap between two of the large boulders shows
a dark passage leading on behind the blockage but there is no way of
reaching it.

31224.name: On Top of Demons Tor
31224.description:
The view from the top of Demons Tor is spectacular. The golden sands of the
desert can be seen extending off in all directions as far as the eye can
see. Situated to the southeast, what looks to be some sort of temple or
shrine can be seen on the horizon. Heading to the west can get to the other
end of the rock, or the rock can be climbed back down to the desert floor.

31225.name: On Top of Demons Tor
31225.description:
The view from here is spectacular. The golden sands of the desert can
be seen stretching all the way to the horizon. There is what looks to be
an etching in the surface of the rock that catches the eye.

exdescs.etching:
A crude drawing has been etched into the rock. It looks to be of a tall
obelisk standing atop a hill.

31000.long: A Bendoumi nomad guardsman scans the desert for any sign of danger.

31001.long: The Bendoumi Wazir stands near the brazier, pondering.

31002.long: The Bendoumi Sheikh Whazim-alik-cabar lounges against a pile of cushions.

31003.long: A goat stands here, bleating softly in between munching on clumps of grass.

31004.long: A goat herder leans on the fence as he watches over the goats.

31005.long: A large desert scorpion shuffles across the sand, hunting for prey.

31006.long: A small, sand coloured lizard tries to blend in with the desert.

31007.long: An old Bendoumi woman stands at the well, laboriously drawing water.

31008.long: A small Sand King spider scuttles across the desert.

31009.long: A sand coloured snake slithers across the desert, looking for food.

31010.long: A Bendoumi warrior stands here, looking alert for signs of danger.

31011.long: A giant desert wasp hovers above the ground.

31012.long: A huge eunuch with a bald head stands here, protecting the Harem girls from danger.

31013.long: A harem girl reclines back on a divan, batting her eyelashes seductively.

31014.long: The Sheikh's head wife stands here, looking stonily at the harem girls.

31015.long: The giant Efreet, Kharag, stands here guarding the camp against attack.

31016.long: The seeker hovers above the ground in a meditative state, musing on the nature of life.

31017.long: The Sheikh of the Alari stands here, looking arrogant and haughty

31018.long: A carrion bird hops through the sands, hunting for rotting meat.

31019.long: An Alari huntsman stands idly by, waiting for something to shoot at.

31020.long: Councillor Asaf frowns as he thinks through a puzzling problem.

31021.long: The Calif of the Bendoumi stands here, bedecked in finery.

31022.long: A merchant stands nearby looking angry and unhappy.

31023.long: A pack camel stands here, stubbornly refusing to move.

31024.long: A camel driver stands here, red-faced with anger.

31025.long: A baggage porter stands here, studiously guarding the inventory.

31026.long: The Head Merchant stands here, worrying about his profits.

31027.long: A rusting metal behemoth clunks along mechanically, accompanied by a whirring of gears.

31028.long: A young scholar stands here sketching the ruins.

31029.long: A huge wasp queen hovers in the air, buzzing loudly.

31030.long: A giant scorpion stands guard over the nest.

31031.long: A small brown desert bug scuttles across the sand.

31032.long: A giant sand serpent writhes here, its head several spans above the sandy desert floor.

31033.long: A gleaming scorpion made from bronze and gold stands here, mechanically chomping its claws.

31034.long: An unusual desert rodent digs at the sand here, looking for roots.

31000.long: A campfire burns brightly, sending flickering shadows across the nearby tents.

31001.long: A large stone well stands in the centre of the camp.

31009.long: An exquisite, night blue caftan resets on the ground, awaiting an owner.

31010.long: The Sheikh's jade pendant has been foolishly dropped here.

31011.long: A pair of exquisite crimson pantalons lies folded on the ground.
